business.headline: Unclaimed wealth is rising in India. How silence around money is costing familiesA growing number of Indian families are learning that wealth without communication can turn into confusion, conflict and costly mistakes. The solution begins long before any will is written.

From TDS gaps to bank errors: Why your ITR refund is delayed and what to do nowSeveral taxpayers in India have not received their income tax refunds for the assessment year 2025-26, with delays attributed to verification errors and compliance checks.

Inside the world of India's ultra-rich: What they buy, how they liveHow are India's wealthiest families redefining luxury today, and what do their latest spending habits reveal about their lifestyles? Let's have a look.

Keys to new homes first, then redevelopment begins: Pranav Adani on Dharavi planPranav Adani said that the Dharavi project is finally progressing with a concrete plan to build around 2 lakh new homes, ensuring residents are moved into these units before any demolition or redevelopment of old structures begins.

NPS expands investment options: Now gold, silver ETFs and Nifty 250 picks allowedIndia's pension regulator issues updated unified investment rules for pension schemes, introducing clearer limits and a wider range of asset classes.

New labour codes: No, your take-home salary isn't reducing. Here's the mathFears of reduced take-home salaries have surged since the new labour codes were notified, but a closer look at the PF calculation shows the impact may not be what many employees expect.

Hindustan Zinc share price jumps over 3%: Why is the stock rising today?Hindustan Zinc's share price advanced over 3% in Friday trading, continuing its upward momentum amid rising silver prices and sector-wide gains in metals stocks.

Sensex jumps over 400 points: Why is the stock market rising todayIndian stock markets opened higher on Friday, buoyed by improved global cues and robust domestic investor activity. Experts highlight the role of the US Federal Reserve's rate cut, domestic retail inflows, and stable earnings outlook in supporting the rally.
Sensex opens 300 points higher, Nifty above 25,900; L&T gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 360.58 points to 85,178.71, while the NSE Nifty50 added 106.90 points to 26,005.45 as of 9:29 am.

ICICI Prudential IPO opens for bidding today: Subscribe or skip?ICICI Prudential AMC opens its highly anticipated IPO for public subscription, offering an opportunity for investors to consider entry into one of India's largest asset management companies.

Take-home salary won't fall under new labour codes, says governmentMany salaried workers had feared that their net monthly income would reduce because the new codes require basic pay and related components to make up at least 50% of total salary.

US should sign free trade agreement if happy with India's offer: Piyush GoyalCommerce Minister Piyush Goyal said the US should sign the free trade agreement with India if satisfied with New Delhi's proposals. The ongoing talks aim to boost bilateral trade and deepen strategic ties between the two nations.

We invest where no one else does: Pranav Adani outlines bold 2026 planPranav Adani said infrastructure will be the backbone of this journey. Roads, airports, ports, energy, utilities and sustainable urban living will play a big role in India's next phase of expansion, and this is where the group is sharply focused.

We are moving towards 5 trillion dollar economy: Pranav AdaniIn his first-ever television interview, Pranav Adani, Managing Director of Adani Enterprises, spoke to Aaj Tak about the Group's vision for 2026 and beyond. He highlighted the 'optimism' surrounding India's journey towards a $5 trillion and eventually a $10 trillion economy, emphasising the critical role of infrastructure.
Sensex, Nifty break losing streak as US Fed rate cut boosts market sentimentsThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 426.86 points to end at 84,818.13, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 140.55 points to 25,898.55.

Eternal stock slides 5% in a month: Should investors worry or look for an entry?The share price has seen sharp swings during the year, hitting a peak of Rs 368.45 on October 15 before correcting in the last quarter.

Why India is the next global hotspot for luxury real estate investmentThe profile of the Indian homebuyer is changing in ways that directly favour the luxury segment. Millennials, who grew up with global exposure, digital access, and rising professional mobility, prefer premium homeownership.

Meesho's stellar debut has Dalal Street abuzz. What should investors watch next?A 50 percent listing pop has put Meesho in the spotlight, yet the real question now is whether its cost edge and logistics scale can hold as the value-ecommerce battle intensifies.

US Fed rate cut: How the move shapes global markets and IndiaThe Fed's third rate cut steadies some nerves and tests others, raising fresh questions on growth, liquidity and currency pressures, but what do these shifting global cues ultimately mean for India?

entertainment.headline: Why Rajinikanth hasn't had a villain like Padayappa's Neelambari in 25 years In over 25 years since Padayappa, Rajinikanth has played countless larger-than-life heroes, yet no villain has matched the force, flair or cultural imprint of Ramya Krishnan's Neelambari.

The Great Shamsuddin Family Review: Anusha Rizvi serves big chaos, not big cinemaRelease Date:Fri Dec 12, 2025 The Great Shamsuddin Family is a portrayal of an Indian Muslim household navigating chaos, love and generational tensions all within a single day. Anusha Rizvi's film offers a relatable glimpse into the bonds that hold families together amid everyday turmoil and societal unease.

Rishab Shetty says Kantara Chapter 1 found its soul in first workshop, shares BTS Rishab Shetty shared heartfelt behind-the-scenes moments from Kantara: Chapter 1, calling the film's first workshop the moment the story "found life" through his actors.

Allu Arjun loves Dhurandhar, calls Ranveer magnetic and Akshaye charismatic Aditya Dhar's spy thriller Dhurandhar crossed Rs 200 crore in seven days, receiving strong praise from actor Allu Arjun for its cast, technical quality, and direction.

Single Papa review: Kunal Kemmu sitcom has vibe of Mehmood's classic Kunwara BaapRelease Date:Fri Dec 12, 2025 The six-episode series focusses on a Haryanvi man who is a single parent. The sitcom is reminiscent of Mehmood's 1974 hit, Kunwara Baap, and also tries to tackle a bunch of important subjects in a light tone.

Hema Malini breaks down remembering Dharmendra and their true love at prayer meet Hema Malini, joined by her daughters, hosted a prayer gathering to honour the memory of her husband and late actor Dharmendra. During her emotional speech, she talked about their marriage and the kind of influence the legendary actor had on her life.

Four More Shots Please 4 trailer: Girl gang returns for one final, fearless ride Four More Shots Please! returns with its fourth and final season, delivering a reunion for the beloved girl gang. The new trailer teases bold choices, emotional closure, and the end of an era.

Dhurandhar box office Day 7: Blazing 1st week for Ranveer's film, past Rs 200 crore Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar has crossed Rs 200 crore in its first week, driven by powerful word-of-mouth. The film is performing exceptionally well overseas, crossing Rs 300 crore worldwide. Its strong trend indicates a massive second weekend ahead.

Bigg Boss 19 winner Gaurav Khanna celebrates birthday with housemates. Videos Bigg Boss 19 winner Gaurav Khanna celebrated his birthday with close friends and fellow contestants, cutting a cake alongside his wife Akanksha and housemates from the show.

Actor Lili Reinhart reveals endometriosis diagnosis after long medical struggle Riverdale star Lili Reinhart has revealed her diagnosis of endometriosis after a lengthy search for answers. She shared a post on Instagram detailing her diagnosis.

Gangnam Style fame Korean rapper PSY reportedly probed for medication violation South Korean rapper PSY is under investigation over allegations that he improperly obtained prescription medications including Xanax and Stilnox. Authorities suspect procedural violations but PSY's agency has denied any misuse.

Rajinikanth turns 75: PM Modi, Kamal Haasan and Dhanush lead birthday wishes Rajinikanth, Thalaivar to millions, turned 75, and social media lit up with tributes. From Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Kamal Haasan to Dhanush, leaders and film stars lined up to celebrate the Tamil cinema icon on his milestone birthday.

The loneliest job: Dhurandhar, Raazi and the hidden emotional toll of being a spy Indian cinema is gradually learning to understand the spy as a man who can't afford much of a happy personal life. Films like 'Dhurandhar' and 'Raazi', and the show, 'The Family Man', are examples. IndiaToday.in reflects on stories that peel back glamour to reveal a human cost no gadget can fix.

Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon 2 review: Kapil Sharma's film is a chaotic multiverse of bridesRelease Date:Fri Dec 12, 2025 Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon 2 doubles down on Kapil Sharma's signature chaos-driven comedy as he juggles four relationships, cultural clashes and endless lies in a laughter-filled sequel.

Salman Khan meets Johnny Depp, presents Red Sea Honoree Award to Idris Elba Salman Khan and Johnny Depp created a global buzz as their unexpected meeting at the Red Sea International Film Festival went viral, with fans calling it a legendary crossover moment.

The man who flips: Decoding Rajinikanth's signature antics Rajinikanth turns 75, with a legacy of unique cinematic antics defining his career of five decades. The superstar's signature moves continue to captivate fans and influence Indian cinema.

Vicky Kaushal cheers Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar: What a mammoth task, hats off! Vicky Kaushal added his endorsement to Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar, congratulating the cast and crew on its technical excellence and box office achievements. He also gave a special shout-out to his Uri director Aditya Dhar.

Shefali Shah shares sweet dance with filmmaker husband Vipul on 25th anniversary Shefali Shah celebrates her 25th wedding anniversary with filmmaker husband Vipul Amrutlal Shah, sharing a heartfelt video of the couple dancing together.

Akhanda 2 review: When logic leaves theatre and Boyapati, Balakrishna take overRelease Date:Fri Dec 12, 2025 Akhanda 2: Thaandavam doesn't just continue the Boyapati–Balakrishna universe, it amplifies it into a realm where logic fearfully steps aside, divinity takes centre stage, and one man with a trishul becomes the entire security apparatus of the nation.

general news.headline: Crackdown over IndiGo fiasco begins, 4 officials who oversaw airline sackedIndiGo chaos: The development comes on a day the DGCA has summoned IndiGo CEO Pieter Elbers to question him on the restoration of operations and the recruitment process.

Shashi Tharoor skips Rahul Gandhi-led Congress MPs' meet, third in a rowCongress MP Shashi Tharoor's repeated absences from key party meetings have stirred unease within the Congress, raising questions about his commitment. Despite explanations citing prior engagements and travel, internal concerns persist as the party seeks to maintain unity during crucial parliamentary sessions.

India in Trump's Core-5 superclub plans? Buzz on G7 alternative growsPresident Donald Trump is reportedly toying with an audacious idea - a 'Core 5' or C5 superclub including the US, Russia, China, India, and Japan. Trump is looking to position it as a potential alternative to the G7.

Jadeja's wife claims cricketers indulge in addictions, gives husband clean chitRivaba Jadeja has claimed that many Indian cricketers indulge in addictions during overseas tours. She stressed that her husband Ravindra Jadeja remains disciplined and free from any vices despite the team's habits.

Why founder of India's first low-cost airline accused IndiGo parent of sabotageCaptain R Gopinath brought Air Deccan in 2003 and introduced the LCC (low-cost carrier) model to India. But he had to sell Air Deccan to Vijay Mallya under pressure from investors after the airline made losses. Gopinath, the pioneer of budget air travel in India, blamed InterGlobe Aviation, IndiGo's parent company, for sabotaging Air Deccan. This is how and why.

No visas for birth-tourism plans: US Embassy warns India travellersThe US embassy in India has warned tourist visa applicants against birth tourism, denying visas on suspicion. The embassy's warning comes at a moment when the US is widening its social-media checks for visas.

Keys to new homes first, then redevelopment begins: Pranav Adani on Dharavi planPranav Adani said that the Dharavi project is finally progressing with a concrete plan to build around 2 lakh new homes, ensuring residents are moved into these units before any demolition or redevelopment of old structures begins.
Ozempic launches in India as Novo Nordisk sharpens its GLP-1 pushIndia's GLP-1 race intensifies with the launch of Ozempic

Skydiver's parachute gets caught in plane, they cut it at 15,000 feet to surviveA skydiver's parachute got caught on the aircraft, forcing a dramatic midair escape and damaging the plane's tail. The incident, revealed by Australian authorities, highlights the risk and safety lessons of the sport.

Pakistan's IMF bailout comes at steep price: 64 conditions in 18 monthsPakistan IMF: For the $7 billion bailout programme, the IMF has imposed 11 additional conditions on cash-strapped Pakistan to reduce governance failures and curb corruption.

Akhanda 2 review: When logic leaves theatre and Boyapati, Balakrishna take overRelease Date:Fri Dec 12, 2025Akhanda 2: Thaandavam doesn't just continue the Boyapati–Balakrishna universe, it amplifies it into a realm where logic fearfully steps aside, divinity takes centre stage, and one man with a trishul becomes the entire security apparatus of the nation.

Keep Your Little Ones Cozy This Winter with Amazon Everyday EssentialsWhether you're looking to care for little ones or find the perfect gift, this collection of baby and kids' essentials brings together nourishment, comfort, and thoughtful design.

What Akshaye Khanna said about marriage 14 years ago is India's reality todayIn a now-viral 14-year-old interview, Akshaye Khanna said he preferred a carefree, responsibility-free life and therefore did not want to marry. Today, many Indians find themselves living out those very views, choosing to remain single to protect their emotional well-being and prioritise their careers and ambitions.

Humiliated, sidelined: Bangladesh President wants to quit mid-termBangladesh President Mohammed Shahabuddin expresses desire to leave office after feeling humiliated by the Yunus-led interim administration. He was elected unopposed in 2023 for a five-year term as the nominee of Hasina's Awami League, which has since been barred from contesting the 12 February election.

Hema Malini breaks down remembering Dharmendra and their true love at prayer meetHema Malini, joined by her daughters, hosted a prayer gathering to honour the memory of her husband and late actor Dharmendra. During her emotional speech, she talked about their marriage and the kind of influence the legendary actor had on her life.

To de-Indianise US companies, top pollster Mark Mitchell plans to start consultancyMark Mitchell, CEO of a leading US polling firm, Rasmussen Reports, has criticised the H-1B visa programme, saying he wants to launch a consultancy to "de-Indianise" American companies. His comments come amid renewed scrutiny of foreign tech workers under Trump's second term.

Deepinder Goyal spotlights student's rise from Blinkit picker to Zomato designerIn a LinkedIn post, Deepinder Goyal shared a screenshot of the message sent by Atharv Singh – a fourth-year design student who had been supporting his education by working with Blinkit before landing a role in Zomato's design team.

Six Gulf nations ban Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar over anti-Pakistan theme: ReportRanveer Singh's spy thriller Dhurandhar has been banned in six Gulf countries due to its anti-Pakistan messaging. Despite the ban, the film continues to perform strongly at the Indian box office.

New labour codes: No, your take-home salary isn't reducing. Here's the mathFears of reduced take-home salaries have surged since the new labour codes were notified, but a closer look at the PF calculation shows the impact may not be what many employees expect.

Shivraj Patil: The minister accused of preferring vanity over dutyShivraj Patil faced criticism for security lapses during attacks like the 2006 Malegaon blasts and the 26/11 Mumbai attacks. However, what came under media scrutiny was his frequent wardrobe changes amid the crises.

Vinesh Phogat's big retirement U-turn after Paris heartbreak, eyes 2028 LA OlympicsVinesh Phogat said on Friday, December 12, that she will return to the mat to chase her Olympic dreams. The 31-year-old had retired from wrestling after the heartbreaking episode at the Paris Olympics. Vinesh gave birth to a baby boy in July, and she said she will have her young cheerleader by her side in the second innings of her career.

In rare unity, Rahul Gandhi's air pollution discussion call gets government nodRahul Gandhi pressed the Lok Sabha for an urgent and structured discussion on worsening air pollution, calling it a cross-party public health emergency. The government signalled readiness, with Kiren Rijiju saying a discussion will be scheduled soon.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi misses record 200, hits 95-ball 171 in U19 Asia CupVaibhav Suryavanshi missed his maiden 200 as he scored a breathtaking 95-ball 171 in the Under 19 Asia Cup against UAE. He slammed nine fours and 14 sixes during his breathtaking innings, registering his 6th hundred in 2025.

Explained: Winners and losers of Mexico's new tariff strike on India Starting January 1, 2026, Mexico will impose tariffs of 5%–50% on 1,460 products from non-FTA countries, targeting cheap Chinese imports but severely impacting India's auto, steel, textile, and chemical exports.

sports.headline: Want to shake hands with Lionel Messi? You can if you pay Rs 10 lakh Lionel Messi's GOAT Tour has sparked excitement, but the Rs 10 lakh price tag for a handshake has stunned fans. The Meet and Greet is shaping up to be the most exclusive experience of his India visit.

IPL in Bengaluru? Chinnaswamy Stadium gets government go-ahead to host matches again Bengaluru's Chinnaswamy Stadium edges closer to normal duty as Karnataka clears matches in principle, but play can resume only after major safety upgrades recommended by the D'Cunha Commission are fully implemented.

Why is Shubman Gill vice-captain? Ex-batter says pained by Sanju Samson T20I snub India vs South Africa: Former India batter Subramaniam Badrinath said he has been pained to see Sanju Samson warming the bench in T20Is despite scoring three hundreds in the last 12 months. He also questioned the team management's continued backing of Shubman Gill.

Nitish Kumar Reddy takes hattrick in SMAT, RCB captain one of his victims Nitish Kumar Reddy stole the spotlight with a brilliant hat-trick that included Rajat Patidar's wicket. Andhra still fell short, but his triple strike remained the defining moment of the SMAT clash.

Jadeja's wife claims cricketers indulge in addictions, gives husband clean chit Rivaba Jadeja has claimed that many Indian cricketers indulge in addictions during overseas tours. She stressed that her husband Ravindra Jadeja remains disciplined and free from any vices despite the team's habits.

Wrestler Vinesh Phogat Makes Retirement U-Turn, Sets Sights On 2028 LA Olympics In a major development for Indian sports, wrestler Vinesh Phogat has announced a U-turn on her retirement, confirming her decision to return to the mat and target the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics. Speaking on India Today, Principal Correspondent Nitin Srivastava reports that the 31-year-old athlete is driven by her 'unfulfilled dream' of winning an Olympic medal, following her heartbreaking disqualification at the Paris Olympics in 2024. Phogat, who gave birth to a baby boy in July 2025, stated that she will have her 'young cheerleader' by her side for this second innings. Srivastava highlights the crucial support of her husband and fellow wrestler, Somvir Rathee, in her preparation. The report underscores Phogat's determination to overcome past setbacks and reclaim her position on the global stage.

Watch: MS Dhoni and Rohit Sharma flaunt their bromance in new ad MS Dhoni and Rohit Sharma's latest ad has given fans a fresh dose of their easy chemistry. Their playful kite-flying banter in the ad has quickly become a favourite moment online.

Karnataka Approves Matches At Chinnaswamy Stadium, But Only After Safety Checks ​​​​​​​The Karnataka cabinet has cleared the way for matches at Chinnaswamy Stadium, but only on tough conditions. A committee report flagged earlier structural and safety lapses, forcing the government to tighten the checklist before reopening the gates. Under the decision, the Home Department will issue the final nod once every recommendation is fulfilled. With a busy cricket season around the corner, the approval is seen as a critical step and a warning that the stadium won't get a free pass this time.

Vinesh Phogat's big retirement U-turn after Paris heartbreak, eyes 2028 LA Olympics Vinesh Phogat said on Friday, December 12, that she will return to the mat to chase her Olympic dreams. The 31-year-old had retired from wrestling after the heartbreaking episode at the Paris Olympics. Vinesh gave birth to a baby boy in July, and she said she will have her young cheerleader by her side in the second innings of her career.

Google, Meta, X ordered to remove fake content at Sunil Gavaskar's request Under the court's instructions, Sunil Gavaskar must submit specific URLs, and the three tech giants are required to take action within a week.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi misses record 200, hits 95-ball 171 in U19 Asia Cup Vaibhav Suryavanshi missed his maiden 200 as he scored a breathtaking 95-ball 171 in the Under 19 Asia Cup against UAE. He slammed nine fours and 14 sixes during his breathtaking innings, registering his 6th hundred in 2025.

Watch: Roger Federer confirms long-awaited Australia Open return with hilarious videoRoger Federer is set for a comeback to the Australian Open stage. Fans will get a long-overdue chance to celebrate his legacy in Melbourne.

Bazball is great, but England go too far with it sometimes: David WilleyDavid Willey believes England's Bazball approach is innovative but warns that players must adapt to situations, especially as England trail Australia 0-2 in the Ashes. Willey highlights missed opportunities and calls for accountability and refinement in England's strategy.

What wrong has Sanju Samson done? Ex-teammate questions Gambhir on live TVRobin Uthappa called out India's decision to drop Sanju Samson from the opening slot in T20Is. With Shubman Gill struggling, his criticism has put fresh spotlight on India's T20I selection.

NZ vs WI 2nd Test: Jacob Duffy's 5-for sets up 9-wicket win for NZ in WellingtonJacob Duffy's outstanding bowling performance led New Zealand to a nine-wicket victory over West Indies in the second Test at Basin Reserve. This win gives New Zealand a 1-0 lead in the three-match series with the final Test set to be played on December 18.

Idolising Virat Kohli, Nikhil Chaudhary dreams IPL stint with RCB legendIn an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, Nikhil Chaudhary spoke about his admiration for Virat Kohli and Kevin Pietersen, and shared his dream of representing Royal Challengers Bangalore in the Indian Premier League.

Gill, Suryakumar's form not a concern, they'll come good soon: Assistant coachIndia assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate has defended captain Suryakumar Yadav and vice-captain Shubman Gill amid their poor T20I form. He expressed confidence that both players will regain form ahead of the 2026 T20 World Cup set to be hosted in India.

Is Gautam Gambhir's fixation on Shubman Gill threatening India's T20 World Cup defence?IND vs SA, 2nd T20I: Gautam Gambhir's persistence with out-of-form Shubman Gill alongside Abhishek Sharma as India's openers has intensified concerns that India's T20 World Cup title defence may be undermined by stubborn selection and ignored warning signs.

Teenagers set Finnish football stadium ablaze after club suffers relegationA historic Finnish football venue now lies partly in ruins after a teen admitted to triggering the fire that destroyed FC Haka's stand. The incident deepened the club's turmoil just weeks after their relegation.

Billie Jean King slams Sabalenka vs Kyrgios Battle of sexes as stars stand firmBillie Jean King's criticism has intensified debate around the Sabalenka–Kyrgios exhibition, but the players remain unfazed. With both stars backing the event, the Battle of the Sexes clash is set to draw global attention in Dubai.

Pep Guardiola praises Real Madrid's Rodrygo amid rising Manchester City transfer buzzPep Guardiola's praise for Rodrygo arrived at a moment when transfer talk around the Brazilian is heating up again. With City previously attempting a move, the admiration now carries layers far beyond a routine post-match compliment.

U19 Men's Asia Cup 2025: Squads, schedule and all you need to knowThe ACC Men's U19 Asia Cup 2025 kicks off on 12 December in Dubai with eight teams vying for regional supremacy and showcasing Asia's next generation of cricket talent. Bangladesh are the defending champions while India and Pakistan are among the other contenders to lift the title.

Messi's visit brings spotlight, but Indian football has nothing to show forLionel Messi is visiting India for the GOAT tour. How ironic is it that the greatest of all time is coming to the country at a time when Indian football is at its worst possible state.

Did India promote Axar Patel to No. 3 to mask Suryakumar Yadav's failures?Robin Uthappa and Dale Steyn slammed India for sending in Axar Patel instead of Suryakumar Yadav during the Mullanpur T20I loss to South Africa. Axar's promotion failed as he scored just 21 off 21 while chasing a target of 214.

FIFA accused of monumental betrayal as fans protest expensive World Cup ticketsFIFA has been urged to halt World Cup ticket sales after it emerged that countries' most loyal fans faced paying extortionate prices for tickets, with the cheapest seats for the final costing over Rs 3.77 lakh.

Suryakumar defends India's decision to promote Axar at No.3 in Mullanpur lossIND vs SA, 2nd T20I: India captain Suryakumar Yadav defended the decision to promote Axar Patel to No. 3 despite India's 51-run defeat to South Africa in the 2nd T20I. South Africa leveled the T20I series 1-1 with a 51-run win in Mullanpur.

Kolkata Ready for Messi: 70ft Statue, SRK and Sourav Ganguly to Welcome LegendIn this Special Report, India Today's Anirban Sinha Roy reports on Kolkata's grand preparations for Lionel Messi. The football icon arrives on Saturday for a historic visit. A 70-foot statue, commissioned by West Bengal Minister Sujit Basu and crafted by artist Monty Pal, awaits him. The reporter notes, 'The football crazy city Kolkata is all gearing up for the grand welcome.' The main event at Vivekananda Yuvabharti Krirangan will see Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, Sourav Ganguly, and Shah Rukh Khan felicitate the legend.

Failed experiments, De Kock carnage: South Africa level series as India capitulateIND vs SA, 2nd T20I: Quinton de Kock's batting carnage and India's failed on-field experiments combined to script a disappointing 51-run defeat for the hosts in the second T20I in Mullanpur on Thursday, December 11.

Why send Axar at No. 3? Indian team management slammed for batting order shuffleIndia coach Gautam Gambhir's decision to promote Axar Patel up the order backfired spectacularly in the second T20I against South Africa in Mullanpur, triggering widespread criticism and fresh scrutiny of the team's muddled batting approach.

Shubman Gill fails again: Fans accuse Gambhir of favouritism in India's T20I teamIND vs SA, 2nd T20I: Shubman Gill failed to open his account in the Mullanpur T20I after Lungi Ngidi claimed his crucial wicket. Fans lashed out at Gautam Gambhir and the selection panel for favouritism.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
